snippet: The leaders of five West African countries, including Nigeria, met Saturday with Western officials and agreed to cooperate in combating the extremist Islamist group.
abstract: Leaders of five West African countries meet with Western officials and agree to share intelligence and strengthen military cooperation to combat regional threat from extremist Islamist group Boko Haram, which abducted more than 200 schoolgirls in northern Nigeria; meeting is held at request of Nigerian president, Goodluck Johnson and organized by Pres Francois Hollande of France.

byline.original: By MAÏA de la BAUME and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter contributed reporting from Maiduguri, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: The leaders of five West African countries, including Nigeria, met Saturday with Western officials and agreed to cooperate in combating the extremist Islamist group.

headline.main: West African Nations Set Aside Their Old Suspicions to Combat Boko Haram
headline.print_headline: West African Nations Set Aside Their Old Suspicions to Combat Boko Haram
